timeline.message: Document why nested class is not static

timeline.author: smillst

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java b/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java index 152419dc3..3262426b9 100644 --- a/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java +++ b/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java @@ -18,7 +18,8 @@ import org.checkerframework.javacutil.BugInCF; /** * A {@link org.checkerframework.framework.type.QualifierHierarchy} where, when a qualifier has - * arguments, the subtype relation is determined by a subset test on the arguments. + * arguments, the subtype relation is determined by a subset test on the elements (arguments). The + * elements must be strings. * *

This assumes that if the lub or glb of two qualifiers has elements, then both of the arguments * had the same kind as the result does.

timeline.bodyText:
This class could be changed to operate on lists of Objects rather than Strings. If you don't want to make that change, then the class comment should mention that the annotation element but be an array of strings.
\
timeline.author: smillst

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java b/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java index 152419dc3..3262426b9 100644 --- a/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java +++ b/framework/src/main/java/org/checkerframework/framework/type/SubtypeIsSubsetQualifierHierarchy.java @@ -18,7 +18,8 @@ import org.checkerframework.javacutil.BugInCF; /** * A {@link org.checkerframework.framework.type.QualifierHierarchy} where, when a qualifier has - * arguments, the subtype relation is determined by a subset test on the arguments. + * arguments, the subtype relation is determined by a subset test on the elements (arguments). The + * elements must be strings. * *

This assumes that if the lub or glb of two qualifiers has elements, then both of the arguments * had the same kind as the result does.
